subject: Fashion
title: Degrowth vs Green Growth in Fashion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Degrowth vs Green Growth in Fashion.

hook.text: Green growth says we can keep buying if we buy better. Degrowth says we simply need to buy less.

buildup.text: Sustainable brands still push consumptionâ€”just greener products. Degrowth challenges buying itself.

discovery.text: Research shows the planet can't sustain current production even if every garment were made sustainably.

twist.text: But 'buy less' is a hard sell in an economy that depends on people buying more every quarter.

climax.text: The real question isn't paper vs. plastic. It's whether infinite growth on a finite planet makes sense.

punchline.text: The greenest shirt is the one you didn't buy.

quiz.question: What does the degrowth movement argue about sustainable fashion?
options: We need to produce more clothes using only organic materials
We need to reduce overall consumption, not just make greener products
We need to invest in faster production technology to reduce waste
